page.title: 12Playground Games
page.content: In the playground we play tick, stuck-in-the-mud, hop-scotch, hide and seek and toy fights.{Tick}is a chasing game. One person is "man" and chases the other children to tick them. The first one ticked becomes "man". To play{stuck-in-the-mud}anyone ticked has to stand still and can only start running again after somebody crawls under their legs. In{hop-scotch}we use the flagstones in the playground. We hop and jump over the square with a stone on, picking the stone up on the way back and throwing it to the next square. {Hide and seek}is a counting and hiding game. One person counts in tens while the rest hide, then she has to find all her friends. Sometimes we play toy fights in the playground, but usually we play it at home in the back garden or the bedroom with our brothers and sisters. (cont.
